alert.note: Alert for Day; Marshall; Roberts (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 1:34PM MST until January 13 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST SATURDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM SATURDAY TO MIDNIGHT CST SATURDAY NIGHT... ...WIND CHILL WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM SATURDAY TO NOON CST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. * WHERE...Marshall, Roberts and Day Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 6 AM CST Saturday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 3 AM Saturday to midnight CST Saturday night. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 AM Saturday to noon CST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
